newsitem.title: UK: OPEC experts meet next week ahead of Vienna talks.
newsitem.headline: OPEC experts meet next week ahead of Vienna talks.

text.p: OPEC's Economic Commission Board (ECB) of market and technical experts from all 11 member countries will meet in Vienna next week to prepare a supply-demand outlook for the second half of the year ahead of the group's summer ministerial conference.
The ECB meeting will get underway on Monday June 16 at the Secretariat's headquarters and should last most of the week, OPEC sources said.
"The main issue is the market but they won't get down to the real discussions until the ministers get together" the following week, a source said.

The cartel's board of governors met two weeks ago to consider the agenda for the ministerial meeting starting on June 25, review oil market developments and discuss administrative and budgetary matters under the chairmanship of Iraqi governor Saddam Zabin Hassan.

Seven ministers met informally in Iran early last month under the auspices of the group's quota compliance committee and renewed pledges to stick to individual crude allocations under OPEC's self-imposed but long-ignored ceiling.
The ministers warned that without plugging their leaky quota system sliding oil prices could fall further and put pressure on national budgets.
The three members of the committee, chaired by Iranian Oil Minister Gholamreza Aghazadeh, is expected to meet again in Vienna ahead of the full ministerial conference.

A growing consensus emerged in Iran to keep the cartel's official 25.03 million bpd ceiling unchanged for another six months. Several ministers have voiced public support for no change in the ceiling.
A Reuters survey put OPEC production in May at 26.95 million bpd, still nearly two million bpd above the ceiling.
